org.jetel.component

Class DataRecordGenerate

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jetel.component.AbstractDataTransform
      • org.jetel.component.DataRecordGenerate
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    RecordGenerate, Transform
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ExtDataGenerator.NullRecordGenerator

    public abstract class DataRecordGenerate
extends AbstractDataTransform
implements RecordGenerate
    Base class used for generating any kind of data generation. Subclass this one to create your own generations. It implements basic stubs for all of the RecordTransform interface methods.

    Order of execution/methods call

    1. setGraph()
    2. init()
    3. generate() for each input&output records pair
    4. optionally getMessage() or signal() or getSemiResult()
    5. finished()
    Since:
    November 1, 2003
    See Also:
    RecordTransform

      • init

        public boolean init()
             throws ComponentNotReadyException
        Method to be overriden by user. It is called by init(Properties,DataRecordMetadata[],DataRecordMetadata[]) method when all standard initialization is performed.
        This implementation is just skeleton. User should provide its own.
        Returns:
        true if user's initialization was performed successfully
        Throws:
        ComponentNotReadyException

      • generate

        public abstract int generate(DataRecord[] outputRecords)
                      throws TransformException
        Generates target data records. Derived class should perform this functionality.
        Specified by:
        generate in interface RecordGenerate
        Parameters:
        targetRecords - output data records (an array)
        Returns:
        RecordTransform.ALL -- send the data record(s) to all the output ports
        RecordTransform.SKIP -- skip the data record(s)
        >= 0 -- send the data record(s) to a specified output port
        < -1 -- fatal error / user defined
        Throws:
        TransformException
        See Also:
        org.jetel.data.DataRecord#copyFieldsByPosition()

      • generateOnError

        public int generateOnError(java.lang.Exception exception,
                  DataRecord[] target)
                    throws TransformException
        Description copied from interface: RecordGenerate
        Performs generator of target records. This method is called as one step in generate flow of records. Called only if RecordGenerate.generate(DataRecord[]) throws an exception.
        Specified by:
        generateOnError in interface RecordGenerate
        Parameters:
        exception - an exception that caused RecordGenerate.generate(DataRecord[]) to fail
        target - Target DataRecord
        Returns:
        RecordTransform.ALL -- send the data record(s) to all the output ports
        RecordTransform.SKIP -- skip the data record(s)
        >= 0 -- send the data record(s) to a specified output port
        < -1 -- fatal error / user defined
        Throws:
        TransformException

        public void signal(java.lang.Object signalObject)
        Description copied from interface: RecordGenerate
        Method which can be used for signaling into generator that something outside happened.
        For example in aggregation component key changed.
        Specified by:
        signal in interface RecordGenerate
        Parameters:
